document.docTitle: Sclerothyone reichi Martins & Tavares 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Two new species of Sclerothyone from the southwestern Atlantic Ocean, with a key to genera and species of Sclerothyoninae (Holothuroidea: Dendrochirotida: Sclerodactylidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new species of Sclerothyone from the southwestern Atlantic Ocean, with a key to genera and species of Sclerothyoninae (Holothuroidea: Dendrochirotida: Sclerodactylidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material. REVIZEE, off coast of São Paulo , Brazil , 24°07’S , 44°42’W ,
11.i. 1998
, 101m, holotype 30 mm ( MZUSP 1644).
Etymology . This species is named in honor of Dr. Mike Reich in recognition for his contributions to the systematics of fossil Holothuroidea.

Diagnosis . Body U-shapped. Ten tentacles, ventral-most pair smaller. Tube feet scattered over body. Calcareous ring plates undivided; posterior processes subdivided and long, up to two times height of calcareous ring plate. Body wall with multilocular two pillared tables; tentacles with rods and introvert with two pillared tables and rosettes. Tube feet with only end plates.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Sclerothyone reichi
sp. nov.
, holotype (MZUSP 1644). (A) lateral view of the body (mouth in red arrow and anus white arrow); (B) anal papillae (black arrow) and (C) calcareous ring; (D) body wall table in upper view (E) and lower view (F); introvert wall table in upper view; (G) rosette from introvert; (H) rod from tentacle and (I) end plate from tube feet. R, radial plate; IR, interradial plate; labels on calcareous ring follow Ludwig’s (1889 –1892) scheme. Scale bars: A, 10mm; B–C, 1mm; D–E 50 μm; F–G, 30 μm; H, 50 μm.

TABLE 1. Synoptic table of morphological characters and distribution of the Sclerothyoninae genera and
Sclerothyone
species. BW, body wall; INT, introvert; TT, tentacle; TF, tube feet; SWA, Southwestern Atlantic and SEA, Southeast Atlantic (South Africa).

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality.
Brazil , off coast of São Paulo , 24°07’S , 44°42’W ,
101 m
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. Known only from the type locality.

Remarks.
Sclerothyone reichi
sp. nov.
superficially resembles
S. velligera
and
S. unicolumnus
, but differs from both species by having (1) multilocular tables in the body wall ( Fig. 1d, e ) and tentacles provided with rods only ( Fig. 1h ) ( vs. four-holed tables in the body wall and tentacles with rods and plates in
S. velligera
; and (2) unfused pillars in the body wall tables ( Fig. 1d, e ), and tables and rosettes in the introvert, ( Fig. 1f, g ) ( vs. fused pillars in the body wall tables and no ossicles in the introvert in
S. unicolumnus
).
